title: Hunt for knifeman who stabbed Jobcentre security guard in broad daylight
text:
The security guard was stabbed while working at a Jobcentre in Liverppol (Picture: Mercury)

A security guard has been knifed in the back at a Jobcentre.

The victim, a man in his 40s, was attacked at the Jobcentre Plus in Belle Vale, Liverpool, at around 11.30am this morning.

The security guard, who works for G4S Secure Solutions, was rushed to a hospital and is currently in a stable condition.

His attacker, described as a white male around 5ft 4ins tall and wearing dark clothing, is being hunted by police after escaping on foot.

Detective Inspector Phil Atkinson said: ‘This is a shocking incident which has occurred in broad daylight in a public place.

‘We are carrying out extensive enquiries to locate the offender.

‘Officers remain in the area to speak to witnesses and provide reassurance.

‘I would ask anyone who witnessed the incident, saw anyone making off from the scene or has any CCTV or dashcam footage to please get in touch.’

The suspect is being hunted by police (Picture: Mercury) Strategic account director for G4S Secure Solutions Alan Thresher added: ‘The incident saw our security officer sustain serious injury and he is now in hospital receiving treatment.

‘I’d like to thank the emergency services for their swift action. We are working with Merseyside Police to support their investigation.’

The DWP confirmed the Jobcentre was closed to allow the police to investigate but phone lines were unaffected and interviews rearranged.

A spokesman said: “The health and welfare of our staff and customers in jobcentres is our primary concern, and we are working closely with police to support their investigation into this incident.”

Anyone with information on the stabbing should contact @MerPolCC, 101 quoting reference 19100579282 or @CrimestoppersUK anonymously on 0800 555 111.
